intro: Vernonia dranensis, commonly known as the Dranès Vernonia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its foliage is often grayish-green, with narrow, linear leaves that reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in a compact cluster, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
